newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela foreign reserves fall $138 million.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela foreign reserves fall $138 million.

text.p: Venezuela's total foreign reserves fell $138 million, or 0.9 percent, in the week to May 19 to $15.641 billion, according to new figures released by the central bank.
Reserves were down from $15.779 billion on May 12, the bank's latest weekly bulletin of indicators showed.

Since the start of the year, reserves have risen $462 million, or three percent. Reserves rose $5.5 billion, or 57 percent, last year to $15.179 billion and government officials have forecast they will grow to $20 billion by the end of 1997.
